page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Pelham arms house Pelham Arms Farm is over 100 years old.Itwas part of Lord Yarborough'estate.it was a farm of about 200 acres.It then became a pub but was closed down in 1900 because of complaints about disturbances by the ironstone workers.The house was built of bricks from the local brick pit.The house is still standing although ther are only about 5 or 6 acres of land attached to it including the pond,the paddock,the wood and the garden.Two of the children living there attend the school and have to catch the school bus every morning.
